sen.j: 中務省・越中国国司・少納言・太宰府等を歴任した後、に57歳でようやく参議となり、公卿に列せられる。
sen.e: After he experienced various positions such as a Nakatsukasa no Shoyu (Junior Assistant Minister of Central Affairs), the governor of Ecchu Province, a Shonagon (lesser councilor of state), and the Dazai no Daini (senior assistant governor general of the Dazai-fu [local government office in the Kyushu region]), he was finally appointed to be a Sangi at the age of 57 in 787, and he became a Court noble.

sen.j: 蘇我赤兄が壬申の乱で没落した以降の蘇我氏（石川氏）は、藤原氏や諸皇族等に押され気味であった。
sen.e: The Soga clan (also known as the Ishikawa clan) had been in a weaker position than the Fujiwara clan and Imperial family members since SOGA no Akae lost his influence due to the Jinshin War, and they had to be in an obscure position in which even a direct descendant of the clan could finally become a Court noble (usually as a Chunagon or a Sangi) in his fifties.

sen.j: 石川氏から公卿が出るのも結果的に彼が最後（石川氏は他にも大叔父の石川豊成の系統があるが、中納言を極官とした彼が亡くなって以降振るわなかた）であった。
sen.e: He was the last Court noble from the Ishikawa clan (the clan also included the family originated from his great-uncle ISHIKAWA no Toyonari, whose highest position was Chunagon, but this family's influence was not so strong either after Toyonari's death), and the clan eventually disappeared from the political stage at the same period that the Isonokami clan (also known as the Mononobe clan), who had had a heated controversy on Buddhism, disappeared.
